Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
full-scale \full-scale\ adj. using all available resources; -- of actions; as, a full-scale effort to find the perpetrator.
Syn: all-out. [WordNet 1.5]
full-scale adj : using all available resources; "all-out war"; "a full-scale campaign against nuclear power plants" [syn: {all-out}]
